name: 2.21 & 2.22 "I'll Be Seeing You" Multiple Choice Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: For what did Coach try to get volunteers?
questions.explanation:
Picnic.

	No one wanted to help Coach so he did everything on his own. But then no one even signed up to go so he used an old man routine to guilt trip the others into going.

questions.text: What did Coach tell Sam would help in his relationship with Diane?
questions.explanation:
physical relations.

	Sam told Coach that he and Diane were going to wait until they were sure about how they felt before having sex. Of course, we knew from the first episode where they started dating that they've been having sex all along.

questions.text: What did Sam decide to do for Diane?
questions.correct: Have an artist paint her picture
questions.explanation:
Have an artist paint her picture.

	Sam wanted to surprise her with an artist but didn't want to spend a lot of money. Cliff knew of a guy that was on his route that was an artist and suggested him.

questions.text: Who did Diane try to strangle with the phone cord?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Diane tried strangling him with the phone cord because Sam lied about telling a reporter about their relationship. She said she wasn't trying to kill him however.

Phillip Samenko.

	Phillip was very strange and Sam disliked him instantly. Diane however loved him.

Christopher Lloyd.

	Christopher Allen Lloyd was born Oct. 22, 1938 in Stamford, CT. He is best known for his roles as Jim Ignatowski on "Taxi" and Doc Brown in the "Back to the Future" trilogy.

questions.text: Who was signed up for Coach's picnic at first?
questions.correct: Ziggy Startdust, the Mad Hatter and Clark Kent
questions.explanation:
Ziggy Startdust, the Mad Hatter and Clark Kent.

	Coach said that they now had an infield. Coach didn't catch on to the joke names at first just that their was three people signed up for the softball game.

questions.text: What did the painter do with everything he painted?
questions.explanation:
made love to it.

	Diane said his most famous painting was of a football team. He said he got a lot of strange reactions with that.

questions.text: Why did the painter say Diane should be alone with Sam (whom he called Mortimer)?
questions.correct: It would be the last time she'd ever see him
options: He just didn't want to be around Sam (Mortimer)
questions.explanation:
It would be the last time she'd ever see him.

	Diane went behind Sam's back to get the pictures done by Phillip. Phillip believed that once Diane told him, he and Diane would break up.

questions.text: Complete this line: "I'm calm, if I were any calmer I'd be __________."
questions.explanation:
dead.

	Diane didn't want Sam to see the picture until he calmed down because if he saw it when angry he wouldn't like it. This caused a fight between them in which they eventually broke up.
